lines.gurmukhi: jYsy Dr DnuK clweIAq bwn qwn clRXo jwie iqq hI kau ijq hI clweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Dhar Dhanoukh Chalaaeeat Baan Taana , Chalyo Jaai Tit Hee Kau Jit Hee Chalaaeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as an arrow is placed in a bow, the bowstring is pulled and arrow released in the direction in which it is intended to go.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy As√ç cwbuk lgwie qn qyj kir dorRXo jwie Awqur huie ihq hI daurweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Asv Chaabouk Lagaai Tan Tayj Kari , Doryo Jaai Aatur Hui Hit Hee Dauraaeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a horse is whipped to make it run faster and agitated, it keeps running in the direction it is made to run

lines.gurmukhi: jYsI dwsI nwiekw kY AgRBwg TwNFI rhY DwvY iqq hI qwih ijq hI pTweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisee Daasee Naaikaa Kai Agrabhaag Tthaanddhee Rahai , Dhaavai Tit Hee Taahi Jit Hee Patthaaeeai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as an obedient maid-servant keeps standing in attention in front of her mistress, and she hastes away to the direction she is sent,

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy pRwxI ikrq sMjog lg BRmY BUm jq jq Kwn pwn qhI jwie KweIAY ]610]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Praanee Kirat Sanjog Lag Bhramai Bhooma , Jat Jat Khaan Paan Tahee Jaai Khaaeeai ?610?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, an individual keeps wandering on this Earth according to the deeds that he had performed (in previous birth). He goes where he is destined to sustain himself.  (610)
